identificationModule.briefTitle: Multifocal Brain Magnetic Stimulation in Chronic Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Innovative Approach to Restoration of Function in Chronic Ischemic Stroke Using a New Wearable Multifocal Brain Stimulator

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Transcranial magnetic stimulation for post-stroke upper-body motor deficits.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This study uses transcranial magnetic stimulation (magnetic pulses delivered through a specially designed cap worn on the head aimed at specific motor areas of the brain (brain areas responsible for the body's physical movements) to test whether upper-body motor function can be improved.

This is a double-blind study where half of participants will receive active transcranial stimulation and the other half of the participants will receive no transcranial magnetic stimulation; all participants will wear the cap. Participants and some members of the research team will not know who received active magnetic brain stimulation.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Active repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation administered through cap worn by patient under healthcare provider.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Double-blind, only the care provider is aware of active treatment assignment.

armGroups.label: repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -On
armGroups.description: Participants wear the repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) cap delivering magnetic stimulation to part of the brain.

armGroups.label: repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -Off
armGroups.description: Participants wear the repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) cap that does NOT delivery any magnetic stimulation to the brain.

interventions.name: repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -On
interventions.description: Cap worn on the scalp will deliver active Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation to specific parts of the brain

interventions.name: repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -Off
interventions.description: Cap worn on the scalp will no delivery of the Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation to any part of the, referred to as a sham or inactive study treatment.

primaryOutcomes.description: Change in number of active voxels in the cortical areas surrounding the lesion on functional MRI
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends, up to 5 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in arm motor function Total score range is 0-66 with the higher number representing a better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends up to 5 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in arm and hand motor function Total score range is 0-57 with the higher number representing a better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends up to 5 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in grip strength The higher the number represents better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends up to 5 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in pinch strength. The higher the number, the better the outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends up to 5 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in gait velocity on Timed Up and Go Test. The lower the time recorded, the better the outcome.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends up to 5 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) Total score range is 0-42 with the lower number representing a better outcome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One business day before treatment begins, one business day after treatment ends up to 5 weeks

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: 38 patients were screened 7 were screen fails. 2 withdrawn. 14 treated-Active, 15 treated-placebo.

groups.title: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -On
groups.description:
Participants wear the repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) cap delivering magnetic stimulation to part of the brain.

repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -On: Cap worn on the scalp will deliver active Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation to specific parts of the brain

groups.title: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -Off
groups.description:
Participants wear the repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) cap that does NOT delivery any magnetic stimulation to the brain.

repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation -Off: Cap worn on the scalp will no delivery of the Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation to any part of the, referred to as a sham or inactive study treatment.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Adverse events were captured from time of first treatment to completion of the final visit at 3 months post treatment. Serious adverse events were captured from time of informed consent to completion of the final visit at 3 months post treatment.
adverseEventsModule.description: All reported events were assessed by the Principal Investigator and resulted in no withdrawals due to study treatment
